what: Wrapper for R to MS Office Packages for Clinical Study Reports
title: Wrapper for R to MS Office Packages for Clinical Study Reports
text: Wrapper R MS Office packages creating clinical study reports ADaM format support.

title: Wrapper for R to MS Office Packages for Clinical Study Reports
text: FunctionReport comprehensive R package designed creating clinical study reports. provides high-level wrapper around popular R--MS Office packages like officer flextable, specifically tailored clinical trial reporting. package supports ADaM (Analysis Data Model) formats includes: Clinical Tables: Demographics, adverse events, efficacy tables, Clinical Plots: Kaplan-Meier, forest plots, waterfall plots, spider plots Statistical Analysis: Descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, survival analysis Parallel Processing: Built-parallelization large datasets ADaM Helpers: Utilities reading processing ADaM datasets Result Classes: R6 classes structured result management

title: Wrapper for R to MS Office Packages for Clinical Study Reports
code: install.packages("FunctionReport")

title: Wrapper for R to MS Office Packages for Clinical Study Reports
code: # Install devtools if not already installed if (!require("devtools")) install.packages("devtools")  # Install FunctionReport devtools::install_github("yourusername/FunctionReport")

title: Wrapper for R to MS Office Packages for Clinical Study Reports
code: # Navigate to the package directory setwd("/path/to/Functioneer/FunctionReport")  # Install the package devtools::install()

what: Basic Example: Create a Clinical Report
title: Wrapper for R to MS Office Packages for Clinical Study Reports
code: library(FunctionReport)  # Load ADaM data adsl <- read_adam("data/adsl.xpt", "ADSL") adae <- read_adam("data/adae.xpt", "ADAE")  # Create a Word document doc <- create_word_document()  # Add title doc <- add_title(doc, "Clinical Study Report", level = 1)  # Add demographics table demo_table <- create_demographics_table(adsl, "TRT01P") doc <- officer::body_add_flextable(doc, demo_table)  # Add page break doc <- add_page_break(doc)  # Add adverse events table ae_table <- create_adverse_events_table(adae, "AEBODSYS", "AEDECOD", "TRT01P") doc <- officer::body_add_flextable(doc, ae_table)  # Save the document save_word_document(doc, "clinical_report.docx")

title: Wrapper for R to MS Office Packages for Clinical Study Reports
code: library(FunctionReport)  # Create a study result object study <- StudyResult$new(   study_id = "STUDY-001",   study_title = "Phase III Clinical Trial" )  # Add a table demo_table <- ClinicalTable$new(   data = adsl,   title = "Demographics",   type = "demographics" ) study$add_table(demo_table, "demographics")  # Add a plot km_plot <- ClinicalPlot$new(   plot = create_km_plot(fit, data = adtte),   title = "Kaplan-Meier Survival Curve",   type = "km" ) study$add_plot(km_plot, "survival")  # Generate Word document study$to_word("study_report.docx")

title: Wrapper for R to MS Office Packages for Clinical Study Reports
code: library(FunctionReport)  # Setup parallel processing setup_parallel(workers = 4)  # Create multiple tables in parallel tables <- create_tables_parallel(   data = adsl,   group_var = "TRT01P",   vars = c("AGE", "SEX", "RACE") )  # Create multiple plots in parallel plots <- create_plots_parallel(   data = adtte,   plot_types = c("km", "forest", "waterfall") )  # Stop parallel processing stop_parallel()

title: Wrapper for R to MS Office Packages for Clinical Study Reports
text: package leverages futureverse ecosystem parallel processing:
code: # Setup parallel backend setup_parallel(backend = "multisession", workers = 4)  # Execute operations in parallel results <- future_lapply(data_list, function(x) {   create_summary_table(x, "TRT01P", c("AGE", "SEX")) })  # Automatic parallel table creation tables <- create_tables_parallel(data, group_var, vars)  # Automatic parallel plot creation plots <- create_plots_parallel(data, plot_types)

title: Wrapper for R to MS Office Packages for Clinical Study Reports
text: Memory-Efficient Operations: memory_efficient_join(), reduce_memory_footprint() Data Loading Optimization: optimize_data_loading(), read_adam_parallel() Factor Level Optimization: optimize_factor_levels() Caching: cache_set(), cache_get(), memoize()

code: # Benchmark parallel vs sequential benchmark_parallel_vs_sequential(   fn = create_summary_table,   data = large_dataset,   workers = c(1, 2, 4, 8) )  # Find performance bottlenecks find_bottlenecks(report_generation_function)  # Generate performance report generate_performance_report("performance_report.docx")

title: Create Change from Baseline Summary Table — create_cfb_summary_table
text: advs ADaM ADVS (Analysis Data Vital Signs) data frame. Required columns include: USUBJID, PARAMCD (parameter code), PARAM (parameter name), AVISIT (analysis visit), CHG (change baseline), treatment variable (typically TRT01P). trt_n data frame named vector containing treatment group counts. data frame, contain treatment variable column N column. Used displaying "N=X" column headers. params Character vector PARAMCD values identifying vital sign parameters include table (e.g., c("SYSBP", "DIABP", "PULSE")). Must match values PARAMCD column advs. visit Character string specifying analysis visit summarize. Must match value AVISIT column advs (e.g., "End Treatment", "Week 12"). title Character string table title. autofit Logical, whether automatically adjust column widths fit content. Default TRUE.

text: pattern Character string defining format pattern: "xx" = 2 integer digits, decimals "xx.x" = 2 integer digits, 1 decimal "xx.xxx" = 2 integer digits, 3 decimals "" = auto-width integers "." = auto-width auto decimals ".+1" = auto decimals plus 1 null_format Format NULL/NA values (default: "–") empty_format Format empty strings (default: "") neg_format handle negatives: "sign", "parens", "abs"
